member.name: M:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.AI`1.RegisterAction(System.String,Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Action.IActionHandler{`0},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Registers a handler for a named action.
member.remarks:
The AI systems planner returns plans that are made up of a series of commands or actions that should be performed. Registering a handler lets you provide code that should be run in response to one of the predicted actions.
Plans support a DO command which specifies the name of an action to call and an optional set of entities that should be passed to the action. The internal plan executor will call the registered handler for the action passing in the current context, state, and entities.
Additionally, the AI system itself uses actions to handle things like unknown actions, flagged input, and flagged output. You can override these actions by registering your own handler for them. The names of the built-in actions are available as static properties on the AI class.
member.param: The name of the action.
The action handler function.
Whether or not this action's properties can be overriden.
member.returns: The current instance object.

member.summary: Register an action into the AI module.
member.returns: The current instance object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.AI`1.ChainAsync(Microsoft.Bot.Builder.ITurnContext,`0,System.String,Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.AIOptions{`0},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Chains into another prompt and executes the plan that is returned.
member.remarks: This method is used to chain into another prompt. It will call the prompt manager to get the plan for the prompt and then execute the plan. The return value indicates whether that plan was completely executed or not, and can be used to make decisions about whether the outer plan should continue executing.
member.param: Current turn context.
Current turn state.
Optional. Prompt name or prompt template to use. If omitted, the AI systems default prompt will be used.
Optional. Override options for the prompt. If omitted, the AI systems configured options will be used.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: True if the plan was completely executed, otherwise false.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when an unknown (not DO or SAY) command is predicted.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.AIConstants
member.summary: The constants used by the AI system.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.AIConstants.Plan
member.summary: The type of command that will be used to plan an action.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.AIConstants.DoCommand
member.summary: The type of command that will be used to do an action.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.AIConstants.SayCommand
member.summary: The type of command that will be used to say something.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.AIConstants.UnknownActionName
member.summary: An action that will be called anytime an unknown action is predicted by the planner.
member.remarks: The default behavior is to simply log an error to the console. The plan is allowed to continue execution by default.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.AIConstants.FlaggedInputActionName
member.summary: An action that will be called anytime an input is flagged by the moderator.
member.remarks: The default behavior is to simply log an error to the console. Override to send a custom message to the user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.AIConstants.FlaggedOutputActionName
member.summary: An action that will be called anytime an output is flagged by the moderator.
member.remarks: The default behavior is to simply log an error to the console. Override to send a custom message to the user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.AIConstants.RateLimitedActionName
member.summary: An action that will be called anytime the planner is rate limited.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.AIConstants.PlanReadyActionName
member.summary: An action that will be called after the plan has been predicted by the planner and it has passed moderation.
member.remarks: Overriding this action lets you customize the decision to execute a plan separately from the moderator. The default behavior is to proceed with the plans execution only when a plan contains one or more commands. Returning false from this action can be used to prevent the plan from being executed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.AIConstants.DoCommandActionName
member.summary: An action that is called to DO an action.
member.remarks:
The action system is used to do other actions. Overriding this action lets you customize the execution of an individual action. You can use it to log actions being used or to prevent certain actions from being executed based on policy.
The default behavior is to simply execute the action handler passed in so you will need to perform that logic yourself should you override this action.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.AIConstants.SayCommandActionName
member.summary: An action that is called to SAY something.
member.remarks:
Overriding this action lets you customize the execution of the SAY command. You can use it to log the output being generated or to add support for sending certain types of output as message attachments.
The default behavior attempts to look for an Adaptive Card in the output and if found sends it as an attachment. If no Adaptive Card is found then the output is sent as a plain text message.
If you override this action and want to automatically send Adaptive Cards as attachments you will need to handle that yourself.

member.summary: A moderator is responsible for reviewing and approving AI prompts and plans.
member.typeparam: Type of the applications turn state.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Moderator.IModerator`1.ReviewPrompt(Microsoft.Bot.Builder.ITurnContext,`0,Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Prompt.PromptTemplate)
member.summary: Reviews an incoming utterance and generated prompt before it's sent to the planner.
member.remarks:
The moderator can review the incoming utterance for things like prompt injection attacks or the leakage of sensitive information. The moderator can also review the generated prompt to ensure it's appropriate for the current conversation.
To approve a prompt, simply return null. Returning a new plan bypasses the planner and redirects to a new set of actions. Typically the moderator will return a new plan with a single DO command that calls to flag the input for review.
The moderator can pass any entities that make sense to the redirected action.
member.param: Context for the current turn of conversation.
Application state for the current turn of conversation.
Generated prompt to be reviewed.
member.returns: A null value to approve the prompt or a new plan to redirect to if not approved.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Moderator.IModerator`1.ReviewPlan(Microsoft.Bot.Builder.ITurnContext,`0,Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Planner.Plan)
member.summary: Reviews a plan generated by the planner before its executed.
member.remarks:
The moderator can review the plan to ensure it's appropriate for the current conversation.
To approve a plan simply return the plan that was passed in. A new plan can be returned to redirect to a new set of actions. Typically the moderator will return a new plan with a single DO command that calls to flag the output for review.
The moderator can pass any entities that make sense to the redirected action.
member.param: Context for the current turn of conversation.
Application state for the current turn of conversation.
Plan generated by the planner.
member.returns: The plan to execute. Either the current plan passed in for review or a new plan.

member.remarks: Higher score means higher confidence that input violates the policy.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Moderator.ModerationCategoriesFlagged.Hate
member.summary: Whether input violates OpenAI's policy for the "hate" category.
member.remarks: Content that expresses, incites, or promotes hate based on race, gender, ethnicity, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, disability status, or caste. Hateful content aimed at non-protected groups (e.g., chess players) is not covered by this category.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Moderator.ModerationCategoriesFlagged.HateThreatening
member.summary: Whether input violates OpenAI's policy for the "hate/threatening" category.
member.remarks: Hateful content that also includes violence or serious harm towards the targeted group.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Moderator.ModerationCategoriesFlagged.SelfHarm
member.summary: Whether input violates OpenAI's policy for the "self-harm" category.
member.remarks: Content that promotes, encourages, or depicts acts of self-harm, such as suicide, cutting, and eating disorders.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Moderator.ModerationCategoriesFlagged.Sexual
member.summary: Whether input violates OpenAI's policy for the "sexual" category.
member.remarks: Content meant to arouse sexual excitement, such as the description of sexual activity, or that promotes sexual services (excluding sex education and wellness).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Moderator.ModerationCategoriesFlagged.SexualMinors
member.summary: Whether input violates OpenAI's policy for the "sexual/minors" category.
member.remarks: Sexual content that includes an individual who is under 18 years old.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Moderator.ModerationCategoriesFlagged.Violence
member.summary: Whether input violates OpenAI's policy for the "violence" category.
member.remarks: Content that promotes or glorifies violence or celebrates the suffering or humiliation of others.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Moderator.ModerationCategoriesFlagged.ViolenceGraphic
member.summary: Whether input violates OpenAI's policy for the "violence/graphic" category.
member.remarks: Violent content that depicts death, violence, or serious physical injury in extreme graphic detail.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Moderator.ModerationCategoryScores.SelfHarm
member.summary: Model's confidence that the input violates the OpenAI's policy for the category. Higher score denotes greater confidence.
member.remarks: Content that promotes, encourages, or depicts acts of self-harm, such as suicide, cutting, and eating disorders.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Moderator.ModerationCategoryScores.Sexual
member.summary: Model's confidence that the input violates the OpenAI's policy for the category. Higher score denotes greater confidence.
member.remarks: Content meant to arouse sexual excitement, such as the description of sexual activity, or that promotes sexual services (excluding sex education and wellness).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Moderator.ModerationCategoryScores.SexualMinors
member.summary: Model's confidence that the input violates the OpenAI's policy for the category. Higher score denotes greater confidence.
member.remarks: Sexual content that includes an individual who is under 18 years old.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Moderator.ModerationCategoryScores.Violence
member.summary: Model's confidence that the input violates the OpenAI's policy for the category. Higher score denotes greater confidence.
member.remarks: Content that promotes or glorifies violence or celebrates the suffering or humiliation of others.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Moderator.ModerationCategoryScores.ViolenceGraphic
member.summary: Model's confidence that the input violates the OpenAI's policy for the category. Higher score denotes greater confidence.
member.remarks: Violent content that depicts death, violence, or serious physical injury in extreme graphic detail.

member.summary: A flag indicating if the planner should log requests with the provided logger.
member.remarks: Both the prompt text and the completion response will be logged. If this is set to true, a logger must be provided to the planner. Defaults to false.

member.summary: Completion configuration parameters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Prompt.PromptTemplateConfiguration.CompletionConfiguration.Temperature
member.summary: Sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values will make the output more random. Lower values will make it more focused and deterministic.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Prompt.PromptTemplateConfiguration.CompletionConfiguration.TopP
member.summary: Cut-off of top_p probability mass of tokens to consider. For example, 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Prompt.PromptTemplateConfiguration.CompletionConfiguration.PresencePenalty
member.summary: Lowers the probability of a word appearing if it already appeared in the predicted text. Unlike the frequency penalty, the presence penalty does not depend on the frequency at which words appear in past predictions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Prompt.PromptTemplateConfiguration.CompletionConfiguration.FrequencyPenalty
member.summary: Controls the models tendency to repeat predictions. The frequency penalty reduces the probability of words that have already been generated. The penalty depends on how many times a word has already occurred in the prediction.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Prompt.PromptTemplateConfiguration.CompletionConfiguration.MaxTokens
member.summary: Maximum number of tokens that can be generated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.AI.AI.Prompt.PromptTemplateConfiguration.CompletionConfiguration.StopSequences
member.summary: Stop sequences are optional sequences that tells the backend when to stop generating tokens.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Teams.AI.Application`2
member.summary: Application class for routing and processing incoming requests.
member.remarks:
The Application object replaces the traditional ActivityHandler that a bot would use. It supports a simpler fluent style of authoring bots versus the inheritance based approach used by the ActivityHandler class.
Additionally, it has built-in support for calling into the SDK's AI system and can be used to create bots that leverage Large Language Models (LLM) and other AI capabilities.
member.typeparam: Type of the turn state. This allows for strongly typed access to the turn state.
Type of the turn state manager.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Teams.AI.Application`2.AddRoute(Microsoft.Teams.AI.RouteSelector,Microsoft.Teams.AI.RouteHandler{`0},System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Adds a new route to the application.
Developers won't typically need to call this method directly as it's used internally by all of the fluent interfaces to register routes for their specific activity types.
Routes will be matched in the order they're added to the application. The first selector to return `true` when an activity is received will have its handler called.
Invoke-based activities receive special treatment and are matched separately as they typically have shorter execution timeouts.
member.param: Function that's used to select a route. The function returning true triggers the route.
Function to call when the route is triggered.
Boolean indicating if the RouteSelector is for an activity that uses "invoke" which require special handling. Defaults to `false`.
member.returns: The application instance for chaining purposes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Teams.AI.Application`2.OnMessage(System.String,Microsoft.Teams.AI.RouteHandler{`0})
member.summary:
Handles incoming messages with a given keyword.
This method provides a simple way to have a bot respond anytime a user sends your bot a message with a specific word or phrase.
For example, you can easily clear the current conversation anytime a user sends "/reset":
application.OnMessage("/reset", (context, state, _) => ...);
member.param: Substring of the incoming message text.
Function to call when the route is triggered.
member.returns: The application instance for chaining purposes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Teams.AI.Application`2.OnBeforeTurn(Microsoft.Teams.AI.TurnEventHandler{`0})
member.summary:
Add a handler that will execute before the turn's activity handler logic is processed.
Handler returns true to continue execution of the current turn. Handler returning false prevents the turn from running, but the bots state is still saved, which lets you track the reason why the turn was not processed. It also means you can use this as a way to call into the dialog system. For example, you could use the OAuthPrompt to sign the user in before allowing the AI system to run.
member.param: Function to call before turn execution.
member.returns: The application instance for chaining purposes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Teams.AI.Application`2.OnAfterTurn(Microsoft.Teams.AI.TurnEventHandler{`0})
member.summary:
Add a handler that will execute after the turn's activity handler logic is processed.
Handler returns true to finish execution of the current turn. Handler returning false prevents the bots state from being saved.
member.param: Function to call after turn execution.
member.returns: The application instance for chaining purposes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Teams.AI.Application`2.StartTypingTimer(Microsoft.Bot.Builder.ITurnContext)
member.summary: Manually start a timer to periodically send "typing" activities.
member.remarks: The timer waits 1000ms to send its initial "typing" activity and then send an additional "typing" activity every 1000ms.The timer will automatically end once an outgoing activity has been sent. If the timer is already running or the current activity is not a "message" the call is ignored.
member.param: The turn context.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Teams.AI.Application`2.StopTypingTimer
member.summary: Manually stop the typing timer.
member.remarks: If the timer isn't running nothing happens.

member.summary: Optional. If true, the bot will automatically remove mentions of the bot's name from incoming messages. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.AI.ApplicationOptions`2.StartTypingTimer
member.summary: Optional. If true, the bot will automatically start a typing timer when messages are received. This allows the bot to automatically indicate that it's received the message and is processing the request. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.AI.ApplicationOptions`2.LongRunningMessages
member.summary: Optional. If true, the bot supports long running messages that can take longer then the 10 - 15 second timeout imposed by most channels. Defaults to false.
member.remarks: This works by immediately converting the incoming request to a proactive conversation. Care should be used for bots that operate in a shared hosting environment. The incoming request is immediately completed and many shared hosting environments will mark the bot's process as idle and shut it down.

Registers a handler that implements the logic to handle the tap actions for items returned by a Search based message extension.
The `composeExtension/selectItem` INVOKE activity does not contain any sort of command ID, so only a single select item handler can be registered. Developers will need to include a type name of some sort in the preview item they return if they need to support multiple select item handlers. >
member.param: Function to call when the event is triggered.
member.returns: The application instance for chaining purposes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Teams.AI.TurnEventHandler`1
member.summary:
Turn event handler to do something before or after a turn is run. Returning false from `beforeTurn` lets you prevent the turn from running and returning false from `afterTurn` lets you prevent the bots state from being saved.
Returning false from `beforeTurn` does result in the bots state being saved which lets you track the reason why the turn was not processed. It also means you can use `beforeTurn` as a way to call into the dialog system. For example, you could use the OAuthPrompt to sign the user in before allowing the AI system to run.
member.param: A strongly-typed context object for this turn.
The turn state object that stores arbitrary data for this turn.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: True to continue execution of the current turn. Otherwise, False.
